meanings.definition: The act of subletting a property to another tenant.
meanings.sent1: The subtenancy of the apartment allowed the original tenant to temporarily rent it out.
meanings.sent2: She signed a subtenancy agreement to rent the room from the main tenant.
meanings.sent3: The subtenancy of the house turned into a game of musical chairs as tenants came and went.
meanings.sent4: His subtenancy of the office space was like being a temporary caretaker of someone else's domain.
meanings.sent5: The subtenancy arrangement was as fleeting as a passing cloud, here one moment and gone the next.

meanings.definition: A lease or tenancy agreement held by a subtenant.
meanings.sent1: The subtenancy document outlined the terms of the rental agreement between the subtenant and the main tenant.
meanings.sent2: She was happy to have a subtenancy in place, ensuring her right to occupy the space.
meanings.sent3: The subtenancy paperwork was so official, it made the subtenant feel like a real tenant.
meanings.sent4: His subtenancy contract was a key that unlocked the door to his temporary living arrangement.
meanings.sent5: The subtenancy agreement was a bridge connecting the subtenant to the main tenant's property.
